childProtectionPolicy.title: Child Protection Policy
childProtectionPolicy.subtitle: SOS CHILDREN'S VILLAGES ORGANIZATION POLICY ON PROTECTING CHILDREN FROM CRUEL TREATMENT CHILD SAFETY CONCERNS EVERYONE

sections.title: Our Principles
sections.content: SOS Children's Villages organization is committed to creating and maintaining a caring and safe environment for children, which helps realize the organization's core values and allows it to combat child abuse and exploitation, as well as prevent such cases. We categorically condemn all forms of child abuse and exploitation, both within and outside the organization, and react to all confirmed and alleged cases or attempts of abuse in accordance with the nature of the child's rights violation. The organization's efforts are aimed at providing mechanisms to raise awareness of this problem, prevent it, and facilitate the registration of complaints and adequate responses to them. Such mechanisms include various measures, from staff development activities, including training and counseling, to temporary suspension from duty, dismissal, or legal proceedings.

sections.title: SCOPE
sections.content: SOS Children's Villages organization is guided by the provisions of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child and the KR Children's Code: ensuring the child's interests is a priority for us. Every child has the right to fully develop their potential, receive quality education, participate in decisions affecting their interests, and be protected from discrimination. Each of us bears responsibility for protecting children from all forms of abuse, neglect of their needs, exploitation, violence, and discrimination. Special attention in this document is given to creating internal mechanisms within SOS Children's Villages for preventing child abuse and responding to it.

sections.title: GOALS OF THE CHILD PROTECTION POLICY AGAINST CRUEL TREATMENT:
Contacts
sections.content: We ask you to be our partners in ensuring that children remain in a safe, caring, and protected environment overall. If you have personally encountered abuse, violence, or injustice in SOS Children's Villages, or if you know that injustice is being or has been committed against others, please contact our staff. Your courage to tell us about violence can help us prevent violence and injustice against children and improve our work to protect children from violence in the future!

contactInfo.workingHours: Our staff can be contacted Monday to Friday from 9:00 to 18:00
contactInfo.email: You can also leave us a message via email: help.safeguard@soskyrgyzstan.kg at any time.

subtitle.part1: 29 years of care and love: the story of SOS Children's Villages

introduction.title: Introduction:
introduction.description: Since 1996, we have been creating a caring home for every child in Kyrgyzstan. Inspired by Hermann Gmeiner's idea, we follow a path where love, family and safety are not just words, but a reality for thousands of children.

card.title: How it all began: the global SOS movement
card.line1: Hermann Gmeiner is the founder who created the first SOS Children's Village in 1949 in Austria.
card.line2: He believed: 'Those who help children today build a better world for tomorrow.'

principles.title: Key SOS principles:

items.title: Mother: Every child has a caring parent
items.description: An SOS mother builds a close relationship with the child entrusted to her and provides the necessary protection, love and care. As a professional employee, the SOS mother lives with the children, is engaged in their development and independently runs the household. She knows and respects the history of each child, his social and cultural roots, religious beliefs and feelings.

items.title: Brothers and Sisters: Family ties are formed naturally
items.description: Girls and boys of different ages live together as brothers and sisters with their siblings in one SOS family. Together with their SOS mother, these children build family ties that continue and are maintained throughout life.

items.title: Home: Every family creates its own home
items.description: Every SOS family has their own home - a house with its own characteristics, rhythm of life and household. Under its roof, children truly feel part of a family and therefore feel protected. Children grow and learn together, share common responsibilities, and share the joys and sorrows of everyday life.

items.title: Village: The SOS family is part of society
items.description: SOS families live nearby, share experiences, support and help each other, creating an atmosphere of care and mutual understanding, in which children feel happy. Thus, every child learns to participate in the life of his family and village, and in general, SOS families act as a single group contributing to the development of the local community.

principles.footer: Today, the SOS network operates in more than 130 countries, helping more than a million children and families.

appearance.title: The appearance of SOS in Kyrgyzstan
appearance.description: In 1996, the country was just beginning work on reforming orphanages. We were the first to propose a family alternative — where every child lives in care and respect, in a real family.
appearance.subtitle: Key events:
cards: Opening of the SOS representation in Kyrgyzstan
Launch of the SOS Children's Village in Bishkek
Opening of the village in Cholpon-Ata
Launch of family strengthening and youth support programs

success.title: 29 years with children and for children
list: More than 800 children were raised in SOS families

quote.title: Our success is the trust, care and strength with which we nurture the future of Kyrgyzstan
quote.caption: from the address of the National Director L. Dzhuraeva

programs.title: The appearance of SOS in Kyrgyzstan
programs.description: Today we not only maintain the SOS model, but also actively participate in development:
list: Vocational training and support for graduates

banner.title: About the SOS Children's Villages Kyrgyzstan Foundation

introduction.title: Introduction:
introduction.description: The SOS Children's Villages Kyrgyzstan Foundation is part of an international humanitarian movement based on a simple but powerful idea: every child should grow up in a loving family.

ourMission.title: Our Mission
ourMission.description: We create long-term, stable and caring conditions for children left without parental care, and support families in crisis to prevent separation from children.

mission.title: Foundation's Mission:
mission.text: Every child deserves a family, love, respect and safety.

doing.title: What We Do
doing.description: Today we not only preserve the SOS model, but also actively participate in development:
items: SOS Children's Villages in Bishkek and Cholpon-Ata

ourModel.title: Our Model: SOS Family
ourModel.description: Each SOS family lives in a separate house. An SOS parent lives with the children - a trained adult who becomes their real guardian and friend.
items: Family home - own comfort and life

results.title: Why It Works
results.description: Research and practice show that children growing up in a family environment develop better, feel more confident, and socialize more successfully.

member.title: Part of the International Movement
member.description: We are part of SOS Children's Villages International, operating in more than 130 countries. At the core is the spirit of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child and respect for the culture of each country.

banner.title: Support Children
banner.description: Every step you take is a chance for a child to have a happy future
banner.supportText: Your support is very important to us!

requisites.mainDescription: Requisites of PF "SOS Children's Villages Kyrgyzstan"

privacyPolicy.title: PERSONAL DATA PROCESSING POLICY
privacyPolicy.subtitle: OF THE PUBLIC FOUNDATION «SOS - CHILDREN'S VILLAGES OF KYRGYZSTAN»

chapter1.title: CHAPTER 1. GENERAL PROVISIONS
chapter1.p1: 1.1. This Personal Data Processing Policy (hereinafter — Policy) defines the activities of the Public Foundation «SOS - Children's Villages of Kyrgyzstan» (hereinafter — Operator) represented by Director Dzhuraeva L.E., regarding the collection, processing and protection of personal data that may be obtained from personal data subjects — Website users, donors, event participants and other persons interacting with the Operator.
chapter1.p2: 1.2. The Policy is developed taking into account the requirements of the Constitution of the Kyrgyz Republic, Law of the Kyrgyz Republic No. 58 dated April 14, 2008 «On Personal Data» (hereinafter — Personal Data Law), Law of the Kyrgyz Republic No. 318 dated December 19, 2009 «On Charitable Activities and Charitable Organizations», as well as other regulatory legal acts of the Kyrgyz Republic.
chapter1.p3: 1.3. The following terms are used in this Policy:

terms.donors: Donors — persons making voluntary donations and other non-prohibited by law receipts to achieve the statutory goals of the Operator.
terms.beneficiaries: Beneficiaries — individuals constituting the target groups of the Operator's activities (orphans and children left without parental care; young people from among them; children and young people at risk of losing parental care; citizens in difficult life situations; as well as members of their families).
terms.operator: Operator — a legal entity that collects, processes and protects personal data.
terms.site: Website — the Operator's information resource on the Internet, accessible at the address:
terms.personalData: Personal data — information relating to a specific or identifiable personal data subject, recorded on electronic, paper and (or) other material media.
terms.users: Website users — individuals visiting or using the Website, in respect of whom personal data processing is carried out.
terms.subject: Personal data subject — an individual to whom personal data relates.
terms.specialCategories: Special categories of personal data — data on health status, racial or ethnic origin, political views, religious or philosophical beliefs, sexual orientation and other data, the list of which is established by law.
terms.blocking: Blocking of personal data — temporary cessation of transfer, clarification, use and destruction of personal data for the period of verification.
terms.crossBorder: Cross-border transfer — transfer of personal data to holders located under the jurisdiction of other states.

chapter1.p4: 1.4. The Policy provisions apply to personal data obtained both before (within previously agreed conditions) and after the approval of this Policy.
chapter1.p5: 1.5. This Policy comes into force from the moment of its approval and is valid indefinitely.
chapter1.p6: 1.6. The Operator is the holder of a personal data array and has passed mandatory registration in the authorized state body for personal data.

chapter2.title: CHAPTER 2. PRINCIPLES AND PURPOSES OF COLLECTION AND PROCESSING OF PERSONAL DATA
chapter2.p1: 2.1. Personal data processing is carried out on the basis of the following principles:

principles.rights: respect for human and civil rights and freedoms;
principles.minimization: minimization of the volume of processed data;
principles.nonMerging: inadmissibility of combining personal data arrays collected for different and incompatible purposes;
principles.security: ensuring security of the individual, society and the state.

purposes.donations: acceptance and accounting of donations (online and offline);
purposes.accounting: maintenance of accounting and tax reporting;
purposes.obligations: fulfillment of the Operator's obligations to donors and beneficiaries;
purposes.legislation: fulfillment of requirements of the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic;
purposes.improvement: improving website operation and quality of service;

chapter2.p3: 2.3. To improve website operation, adapt materials and offers to user interests, ensure technical functioning, as well as for analytics, the Operator processes data on device IP addresses, browser history, device type, operating system, visit time, activity log files, «cookies» files and similar technologies, including data collected by Google Analytics, Yandex.Metrica, as well as the Salesforce system.

chapter3.title: CHAPTER 3. LIST OF PROCESSED PERSONAL DATA
chapter3.p1: 3.1. In relation to donors (individuals), the Operator processes:

donorData.name: surname, first name, patronymic;
donorData.payment: payment details (to the extent necessary for conducting a transaction through the payment system, including partial bank card details).

chapter3.p2: 3.2. In relation to Website users and social networks:

userData.social: information from social networks (subject to access provided by the subject);
userData.actions: data on actions on the Website;
userData.public: other information that the personal data subject makes publicly available.

chapter3.p3: 3.3. In relation to offline event participants:
chapter3.p4: 3.4. Processing of special categories of personal data, as well as data of minor beneficiaries, is allowed only with the written consent of the subject or his/her legal representative with enhanced security measures.

chapter4.title: CHAPTER 4. PROCEDURE AND CONDITIONS FOR PERSONAL DATA PROCESSING
chapter4.p1: 4.1. Personal data processing is carried out with the consent of the subject, except for cases provided by the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic.
chapter4.p2: 4.2. Transfer of personal data to third parties is allowed:

thirdParty.storage: for data storage and processing using cloud services (including Salesforce);
thirdParty.authorities: to state bodies upon request on legal grounds.

chapter4.p3: 4.3. Cross-border data transfer is carried out subject to compliance with the requirements of the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic, including transfer to countries providing adequate protection of personal data.
chapter4.p4: 4.4. Processing includes: collection, storage, systematization, use, anonymization, transfer (including cross-border), blocking, deletion.
chapter4.p5: 4.5. Upon written request of the subject, the Operator provides information about the existence and content of his/her personal data, purposes and legal grounds for processing, categories of recipients, storage periods and facts of cross-border transfer within no more than 7 calendar days. Information is provided free of charge; a fee may be charged only for material media within their cost.

chapter5.title: CHAPTER 5. RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE PARTIES
chapter5.p1: 5.1. The personal data subject has the right to:

subjectRights.know: know what data the Operator processes;
subjectRights.modify: demand their modification, addition or deletion;
subjectRights.info: receive information about legal grounds, terms and purposes of processing, methods of processing, location of the Operator, persons with access, source of data receipt, terms of processing/storage, procedure for exercising rights, facts and countries of cross-border transfer;
subjectRights.copy: receive copies of his/her personal data and demand their updating/correction;
subjectRights.block: demand blocking of data for the verification period and/or destruction of data on grounds provided by law.

operatorDuties.compliance: process data in accordance with the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic;
operatorDuties.access: provide subjects with access to their data;
operatorDuties.destruction: destroy or anonymize data upon achieving the purposes of processing.

chapter6.title: CHAPTER 6. MEASURES FOR PROTECTION OF PERSONAL DATA
chapter6.p1: 6.1. The Operator applies organizational, legal and technical measures for data protection, including:

measures.security: use of antivirus tools and encryption;
measures.control: control of access to information systems.

chapter7.title: CHAPTER 7. FINAL PROVISIONS
chapter7.p1: 7.1. All issues not regulated by this Policy are regulated by the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic.
chapter7.p2: 7.2. The Policy is posted on the Website:
chapter7.p3: 7.3. The Operator has the right to change the Policy without prior notice.
